intro: Senecio capillifolius, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and yellow composite flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Senecio capillifolius is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
